dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I said!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But - what can we accomplish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can ram him! The others exchange quick, frightened looks.  Dave is incredulous.  Carl moves over to Wendover, admonishes quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've weighed the consequences, Captain - the lives involved? Reef glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor -- I've weighed the lives Cyclops has taken, already...and will take, in the future, unless we can stop him, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We might find other means...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What other means?  If the Tiger Shark can't destroy him, no power on Earth can!  Now brave yourselves! Carl subsides, catches Reef's eye, looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These INTERCUT with faces, above.

dialogues.speaker: THE TIGER SHARK
dialogues.text: Now it begins to rise slowly from its bed in the depths. Water pours from the ballast tanks.  Then, with the boat floating free in the water...

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE SHOT
dialogues.text: as they begin to churn, picking up speed, then, finally, churn the water into a foamy wake.

dialogues.speaker: THE TIGER SHARK
dialogues.text: Like a great, predatory fish, it rises from the bottom, moving more and more swiftly.  It makes a great climbing turn directly TOWARD CAMERA, then goes overhead and out, speeding toward the saucer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are all braced against the impending crash.

dialogues.speaker: WENDOVER
dialogues.text: as he speaks into the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Captain!  All crew members take collision stations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OMITTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Griff AD LIBS orders for the men to lie in their bunks, brace themselves against structural members, etc.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER SHARK
dialogues.text: It has climbed to a level with the saucer, now levels off.  It is picking up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He adjusts the TV view screen, tenses for the shock. Reef appears just behind him.  They exchange a grim look, then eye the screen, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: OPTICAL SHOT
dialogues.text: Now we see the saucer looming up hugely, directly ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as we hear Dave's voice: DAVE (o.s.) Stand by -- five seconds...four... three...two...

dialogues.speaker: SAUCER AND TIGER SHARK
dialogues.text: as they meet.  The Tiger Shark plows into the protective jelly, which slows but cannot stop the juggernaut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: plowing into the protective jelly.

dialogues.speaker: THE CRASH
dialogues.text: as the Tiger Shark, unstoppable, plows inexorably through the protective coating, slams against the saucer itself,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED) then buries its bow deep within the Cyclops - like a har- poon driving into a huge creature of the depths.  Perhaps a third of the Shark's length is driven deep into the saucer.  Tremendous RENDING, TEARING NOISES accompany the crash, after which...complete, eerie silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bow rends the outer envelope of the saucer, the screws of the Tiger Shark churn powerfully against the restraining jelly...then a CLOSE SHOT of the Cyclops' 'eye' shows the glow diminishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we see the situation, that the nose of the Shark is buried deep within the saucer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphantly) We got him, Skipper - drove right into him!

dialogues.speaker: ABOUT DAVE
dialogues.text: as Wendover manages a grim, satisfied smile.  Kent and Sir Ian eagerly check the view plate, and the gauges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speared him like a fish! Wendover moves to the intercom, announces:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Skipper!  We did it, men!  Drove right through the saucer's hide!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the men cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) We'd better wiggle loose. (speaks into intercom) Reactor Room:  I want all re- verse, full!

dialogues.speaker: TIGER SHARK AND CYCLOPS
dialogues.text: Jammed together, they are sinking slowly in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overcoming the initial resistance of the jelly, they begin slowly turning.

dialogues.speaker: TIGER SHARK AND CYCLOPS
dialogues.text: It is obvious, now, that they are headed for the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room seems to vibrate as the mighty atomic reactor turbines exert full power on the propellers.  Then Reef shakes his head, discouraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're stuck tight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Skipper!  Look at the depth gauge! Wendover comes over, peers over Dave's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE UP
dialogues.text: The dial moves rapidly.  Now it is at 175 fathoms, rapid- ly moves to 180.

dialogues.speaker: PAST DAVE AND WENDOVER
dialogues.text: as Wendover, momentarily puzzled, remarks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and eighty fathoms! We can't be sinking that fast....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming over) It's the screws, Skipper. (gestures to explain) At our declination angle, running in reverse, they're pulling the Shark and Cyclops right to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowns at gauge) And we're at safe maximum depth already.... (then barks and order) Stop engines! Reef repeats the command into the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop engines!

dialogues.speaker: CYCLOPS AND SHARK
dialogues.text: sinking through the water, pulled lower and lower by the Shark's engines.  Now the propellers stop.  The two craft still continue sinking, but more slowly now.

dialogues.speaker: WENDOVER'S HAND WRITING IN LOG
dialogues.text: as the hand records:  JULY 15, 10:00 HOURS.  NOW LYING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours later, the two titantic craft were still locked to- gether in an apparent death grip...

dialogues.speaker: TIGER SHARK AND CYCLOPS
dialogues.text: lying on the ocean bottom, still with the Shark jammed into the saucer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...on the bottom of the Arctic Ocean, nearly twelve hundred feet below the surface!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present are Wendover, Carl, Reef, Kent, Sir Ian and Dave. This is a grim, hopeless conclave.  The silence, except for a faint trickle of water somewhere, is complete, eerie, ghastly.  Faces are bathed in tense perspiration. Wendover shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anyone has any more ideas... I'll try anything, before just lying here, waiting to die! Now Reef explains an idea he has been toying with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose there's an atmosphere, of some kind, inside Cyclops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blankly) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the group) If we could get inside the saucer - use our torches - maybe we could cut the Shark loose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all very fine, young man. But how would one go about get- ting inside Cyclops? Reef takes a deep breath, throws a glance at Carl, then says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the eye - with the Depth-Explorer! Carl seizes this eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes - the Explorer was built to operate at even greater depths --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disturbed) But suppose there isn't an atmos- phere inside the saucer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bluntly) Then the idea's no good.  But we're no worse off than we are right now. Dave picks this up eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to let us try, Skipper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) 'Us?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) Reef and I can take the Explorer down, clamp it around the eye, and ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) No, you can't.  But I can -- (to Reef) I can deliver you to the eye. Then you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED - 2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sneeringly) Little out of your line, isn't it?  You better stay aboard and make a speech -- maybe get 'em to ban flying saucers! Carl bridles angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, Holloway.  I've told you before, wearing boards on your shoulders, and parading with a stiff spine doesn't auto- matically endow you with back- bone - !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - any more than being the son of Captain Neilsen does! Wendover is watching this exchange with growing dis- pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However our ideas disagree, as I've said before, I'm not a coward!  And it happens you've got no choice:  Either I take you down there, in the Lungfish, or you don't get there -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly) I'd sooner swim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) That's enough, Reef! Both of you! (to Reef) It so happens Dr. Neilsen's right.  The odds are long enough, without making them longer. (he turns to Carl) Get the Explorer in the airlock, ready for launching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED - 3) Carl nods.  Throwing a final look at Reef, he goes to the passage way, climbs down.  Wendover turns back to Reef, suggests:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better take Powell and Carney with you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The frogmen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With their underwater experience, they'll be invaluable.  Take sidearms, and flare pistols --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Sidearms?  But the saucer's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up crossed fingers) We hope! Wendover holds out his hands, shakes both theirs. Reef turns to Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get ready. They head for the passage way and exit.  Wendover looks at Sir Ian and Kent, shakes his head solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the single hatch open, in which the Depth Explorer has been mounted.  Carl, in a jumper and helmet, waits by the step with Powell and Carney, dressed in their rubber suits, with helmets and face plates.  They carry breathing apparatus.  Behind them, Dave and Reef appear, dressed similarly, carrying their equipment - portable torches, a bag of tools, sidearms, flare pistols, and... in Dave's case...a machine pistol (burp gun).  Over this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preparations consumed only an hour.  At 1100, everything was ready for this last, desperate attempt. Now the four men join Carl at the airlock.  Carl is tense, tight-lipped.  Reef frowns, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still time.  You could show me how...? Carl shakes his head firmly, gestures toward the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO COVER
dialogues.text: the action of the five men climbing down hatch (into Explorer).  When all are inside, Griff steps forward, closes the hatch.  Then he closes the airlock, and goes to intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Griff's voice comes over the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED) GRIFF (o.s.) (filter) Ready to open Airlock door, Captain! Wendover glances once at Kent and Sir Ian.  Then he moves to the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Go ahead, Griff!

dialogues.speaker: BELLY OF TIGER SHARK
dialogues.text: Now we see the lock door slide open.  A moment later, the Depth-Explorer moves out through the opening, like an animal being born.  It hovers for a moment, just below the Shark.  Then it maneuvers o.s. towards the Cyclops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl operates the controls.  The five men are wedged in shoulder to shoulder.  Reef makes a gesture of direc- tion.  Carl nods, complies.

dialogues.speaker: THE CYCLOPS
dialogues.text: Now the Depth-Explorer moves into frame, drifts directly toward the great 'eye' - which still has a faint glow.

dialogues.speaker: AT CYCLOPS' EYE
dialogues.text: The Depth-Explorer moves up with its hatch clamped magnetically, directly over the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Dave turns to Reef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at others, his glance lingering on Carl) Now what - shall we take a chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solemnly) That's why we came. Reef nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. (then) Better breathe oxygen, just in case. The others all apply oxygen tubes to their mouths, go down hatch, Reef picking up a large tool like a wrecking bar.

dialogues.speaker: 260A UNDER HATCH
dialogues.text: Reef and Dave come down hatch into scene.  We see the iris and Reef goes to work on it with the tool.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE UP
dialogues.text: as Reef's tools batter at it.  Suddenly, it gives away.

dialogues.speaker: SHOOTING AT EYE
dialogues.text: as, suddenly, it SEEMS TO OPEN, LIKE A CAMERA IRIS, leaving a circular opening, big enough to crawl through.

dialogues.speaker: 262A REACTION
dialogues.text: Now Reef sniffs at the atmosphere that pours in from the saucer.  Surprised, enthused, he removes his oxygen tube, breathes deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air!  Pure air!  Under high pressure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a relief!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens now, sir?

dialogues.speaker: 262C UNDER HATCH
dialogues.text: Reef thinks a moment, then decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all wait here.  I'm going inside, take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insistently) Not alone, you're not! The men ad lib (no)! Reef frowns at them, then grins gratefully, squeezes Dave's arm, and moves toward the open eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, men!

dialogues.speaker: 262E UNDER HATCH
dialogues.text: Reef smiles, begins crawling through the eye and into the saucer, followed by the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERLAPPING ACTION as the four men crawl down through the hole into this section of the ramp of the saucer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reef gestures, leads the way down the ramp.  Dave is at his elbow, the two frogmen just behind them.  They light TORCHES or FLASHLIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: 267F FOUR MEN
dialogues.text: They come down ramp section to chamber, stop, and look off screen.

dialogues.speaker: TOWARD WOUND MADE BY TIGER SH
dialogues.text: And we see the bow of the submarine extending into the chamber.  But, strangely, there is not a drop of water, not a break in the surrounding wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) How about that! The bow drove half through her, but she sealed herself right up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) What's more important - there's our problem. (points) The bow ram - the sawteeth are holding the Shark in the break. If we can cut the ram, the Shark can pull herself loose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthused) I think you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Powell) Go back and tell Dr. Neilsen. Have him report to the Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED) Powell nods, retreats.  The others unsling their equip- ment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let's get to work. They light the torches, and advance on the protruding bow of the sub (o.s.).

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE UP
dialogues.text: as they begin biting into the metal of the submarine ram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has the radio mike in his hand and calls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depth-Explorer to Tiger Shark. Do you read?  Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper himself wears the headphones.  He cries ex- citedly into the radio mike:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We read you!  Go ahead, Doctor! (then, as he listens eagerly, repeats) They're inside the saucer.  It's filled with breathable air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listening, then enthusiastic) That's wonderful, Carl! (to others) Reef thinks they can clear the Shark bow so we can pull ourself loose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ever the scientist) What is it like, inside Cyclops? This is a priceless opportunity for.... But Wendover ignores this, admonishes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Reef:  Be sure you're all clear before we make a move! Good! He takes off the headphones, beams at the other men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we'll come out of this yet!

dialogues.speaker: THE CON
dialogues.text: And now Griff, operating the navigation equipment, frowns perplexed, then calls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper - could you take a look here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inertial navigation system. Must have been knocked out in the crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're dead in the water.  But it indicates we're moving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What???? Sir Ian and Kent exchange a look, come over and join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's impossible!

dialogues.speaker: REVISED 5-26-59 "ATOMIC SUBMARINE" 97
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED) Now Kent notices something.  He points:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radiation level - from the saucer - it's rising!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly fearful, to Wendover) What direction does the system indicate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly grim) Due north.  At five knots...no, six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grave, thoughtful) Toward the Pole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (demanding) But - that cyclops is dead!  We killed it...didn't we? (as they look away) Didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: TIGER SHARK AND CYCLOPS
dialogues.text: with Depth-Explorer still clamped to the eye.  Now we see, definitely, that the two craft, locked together, are indeed moving, slowly but perceptibly, along the ocean floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weirdly lit in the glow of the torches.

dialogues.speaker: REEF
dialogues.text: As he works, a weird SOUND OSCILLATION - varying wildly in pitch - sweeps over scene.  Reef reacts, startled.  The SOUND COMES AGAIN, and Reef turns, calls sharply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave?

dialogues.speaker: WITH DAVE
dialogues.text: As he detaches himself from the frogmen, moves into TWO SHOT with Reef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen! (the SOUND comes again) Hear that? Dave has not reacted at all.  He looks peculiarly at Reef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear anything. (he looks at Reef, concerned) Maybe you've been down here too long.  Why don't you go back up and -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange you didn't hear it.

dialogues.speaker: THE TORCHES
dialogues.text: biting deeply into the steel of the ram.  Now CAMERA TILTS DOWN SLOWLY, and as it is moving we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though we see nothing of its construction at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black, catfish-or-sea urchin-like spines seem to rise from limp supineness.  They stiffen, grope like fingers, move towards a series of grommet-like openings in the translucent wall of the sphere.  Now a spine nears a grommet, slips into it, apparently making 'contact', for somewhere, a FAINT LIGHT comes on, and the scene becomes lighter.  In a moment, another spine slips into another grommet-hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To an accompanying tympany BEAT, a LIGHT SPOT, appears. A moment later, another drum beat, another LIGHT SPOT. (Note:  This business may continue behind subsequent dialogue - more beats, more lights coming on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reef continues working with the torch.  Dave pushes up his goggles, reacts, surprised.  He taps Reef on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - you know somethin'?  It's getting lighter in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a similar re- action) You know - it is? Now they give a sudden lurch.  Dave looks down at his feet, then into Reef's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I didn't know better - I'd swear we were moving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get back to work, and maybe we will be, soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks about, worriedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) ...I get an impression of move- ment, Captain.  Is that possible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through phones) We have the same reaction, up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very worried) But ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Skipper turns to the scientists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they feel it...down below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning at gauge) Radiation level...constantly rising...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmurs thought- fully) As we near the Pole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) There's got to be an explanation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mildly) There is. (as they study him) I believe our friend...Cyclops... is returning to life! A grim reaction, all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as, now, the last of them contact their proper control points, and a complete circuit of lights FLASHES ON. The LIGHT INTENSITY rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: working on the ram.  Now, with a final cut with the torch, there is a CLANG, A RINGING SOUND, and then the ram drops free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with satisfaction) That does it!  I think the Shark can pull clear! Now, we hear a weird, mechanical voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Holloway!  Listen! Reef reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking blank) The sound again? Now the voice repeats:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Holloway.  Make no resistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) A voice, this time.  It spoke my name! Reef draws his gun and Dave raises his machine gun. (OMITTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now the voice comes from another quarter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will see that avails nothing! Reef looks around, startled.

dialogues.speaker: WITH POWELL
dialogues.text: His nerve is going.  He edges away from the group, then turns to bolt out of scene, heading for the Depth- Explorer.  But just as he takes his first steps...

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: As he stumbles through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: 286A FLASH OF LIGHT
dialogues.text: A flash of light comes down at Powell from somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: The light envelops him, and he cringes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carney - help!

dialogues.speaker: CARNEY DAVE REEF
dialogues.text: Reacting to Powell's cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carney, see what's happened to Powell. Carney moves o.s.

dialogues.speaker: POWELL
dialogues.text: We see the horrible effect of the light on his face.

dialogues.speaker: 287C TRICK EFFECT
dialogues.text: Powell is shrivelled by the light.  The last thing we see of him is...

dialogues.speaker: 287D TRICK EFFECT
dialogues.text: They disintegrate to Jelly, and Powell is completely gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he reaches the spot where Powell was killed.  He reacts, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves away hurriedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he turns, from the blackness, a burst of steam issues forth into his face.

dialogues.speaker: CARNEY
dialogues.text: He screams as the steam envelops him and sinks out of scene.

dialogues.speaker: CARNEY
dialogues.text: As Carney's body disintegrates into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE REEF
dialogues.text: Unaware of Powell and Carney's fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think the voice you heard was coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points farther down the ramp) Somewhere down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder where Powell and Carney are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to look for them later. They move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue down ramp.  Reef looks expectantly at Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you!

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR
dialogues.text: They come clambering down the ramp, reach the platform level.  Then, awed, they look around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a long, slender bridge, or catwalk, extending out into space, apparently reaching toward a great, opalescent sphere that seems to hang suspended on cushioning points, some sort of shock-absorbing system, in the very center of the saucer.  A weird GLOW, seem- ing to become ever brighter, emanates from inside this sphere.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE AND REEF
dialogues.text: Awed, round-eyed, silent, they stare open-mouthed at the sight.  But before they can make any comment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remove your weapons, Commander. And come here - alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come where? Dave looks at him peculiarly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice again? But Reef is too intent on the voice.  Now he begins dis- arming as Dave looks incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: FROM THEIR P.O.V.
dialogues.text: Now, at the very tip of the spine-bridge, an IRIS OPENING appears in the side of the sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now seeming to come from this opening) To me - here!

dialogues.speaker: REEF AND DAVE
dialogues.text: Reef has a distant look as he hands his weapons to Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here - keep these. (then) It wants me to come alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flaring) Oh it does??? Reef moves o.s. toward the bridge.  Dave waits, very unwillingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He inches his way tortuously across the slender support, toward the iris opening.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND REEF
dialogues.text: He crawls cautiously towards the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angry, impatient, he sets Reef's weapons down.  Then he clutches his submachine gun, watches Reef o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Reef appears, crawls cautiously up into the opening, then stands, looks inside.  His eyes nearly start from his head as he takes in the incredible sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes range over the ceiling of the glove, then as he shifts his gaze to the bottom of the sphere, we see 'it' - a horrendous organism, like a giant sea urchin, the long, black, writhing spines now all in proper contact

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED) with their grommet-sockets.  And out of the center of the pulsating central 'body' rises a long stalk, and on the very tip of it a great, glowing 'eye.'  The setup is like a monstrous rendering of the eye of a snail.

dialogues.speaker: UP PAST 'EYE' AT REEF IN IRIS
dialogues.text: So he appears a tiny, miniature man compared to the cavernous size of the sphere.  And now, apparently from the 'eye' itself, which seems to flicker and glow like an electron beam spectrometer, comes the saucer-voice again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Commander Holloway - as you Earth inhabitants would express it - we meet 'face to face.'

dialogues.speaker: REEF
dialogues.text: As he says with sardonic inflection:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a face???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point of view is everything. To us, your form of life is ugly as we appear to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something:  Why can I hear you, when the others couldn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not 'hear' me!  Our in- dividual brain frequencies are now attuned, and we exchange wave-thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean 'Extra Sensory Per- ception?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever your 'earth-term' may be.  The principal is ancient, and very simple.

dialogues.speaker: REEF
dialogues.text: Listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is not necessary for you to speak.  Your 'thought-response' will suffice. (Note:  From here on, in speech with the saucer, Reef's lips do not move - his responses, except to Dave, are all 'voice over')

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cannot contain himself any longer, is now crawling out onto the bridge, toward Reef; cradling the sub- machine gun on his forearm as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversation continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mission is to study various solar systems, and planets - select the most suitable for colonization -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - for horrors like yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  It may interest you to know I have visited hundreds of other worlds, and of all of them, your Earth seems most suit- able.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drily) Swell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly) Your friend was to remain where he was!

dialogues.speaker: REEF
dialogues.text: He looks a bit bewildered:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am afraid not.  Therefore - Now, to Reef's consternation, Dave suddenly appears be- side him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dave, lip sync) Dave - !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly) What's goin' on in here, Lad? What - ? Then, Dave's mouth drops open, and he stares, incredulous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warningly) Stand away from him, Commander!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE AND REEF
dialogues.text: As Dave, before Reef can stop him, steps forward belligerently, levels and submachine gun down at the creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacingly) So this is 'headquarters,' huh? Well, you've sunk your last ship, you.... And he looses a burst with the sub-machine gun, so that we don't hear the appropriate name.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: With a BOOM of tympany, a LIGHT STRIKES Dave, and suddenly he is melted, shrivelled to nothingness.  The machine gun falls o.s.

dialogues.speaker: REEF
dialogues.text: As he looks on, shocked, sobered, shaken.  Then, in his thought-voice, he asks slowly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not me?  What am I - the closing act?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary.  I want you - unharmed - perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have selected you, to return with me - along with several other specimens, for study.  We will examine you and the others, discover desirable features to incorporate in our 'earth-colonizers.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you just...'build them in?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  Evolution is much too slow a process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On earth you build with inanimate material.  We employ living tissue. This space vehicle, for example...

dialogues.speaker: REEF
dialogues.text: Awed, frightened, he looks about him at the construction of the chamber in which he is standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a living thing.  When damaged - you would say 'wounded' - it immediately 'heals' itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding) That's why no water leaked inside when we rammed you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  But it is time to be- gin the return voyage --

dialogues.speaker: REEF'S HAND
dialogues.text: And we see it creep up under his coat, grabbing the Very pistol.

dialogues.speaker: REEF
dialogues.text: as he says grimly, threateningly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To navigate, won't you have to... see your way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That might be a little rough! And Reef raises the Very pistol, fires.

dialogues.speaker: THE 'EYE' OF THE ORGANISM
dialogues.text: as the flare strikes it and bursts.  There is a SCREAM, an unearthly, shattering WAIL from the organism itself.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSE ON 'EYE'
dialogues.text: as the flare burns a hole in the iris, and the water, or whatever it contains, seems to drain from it, like a plastic bag when it is torn.

dialogues.speaker: REEF
dialogues.text: He reacts quickly, astonished at the effect of his shot.  But then he wastes no time - turns and scrambles back out.  SCREAMS OF PAIN from the creature follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heedless of the danger of falling, he scrambles madly back across the bridge.  Beams of the death-dealing light just miss him as he goes, and SCREAMS from the wounded creature shatter the cavernous silence. (OMITTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches the platform, races madly for the ramp. Beams of light again just miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly, as he reaches the iris, he YELLS with pain, his foot caught in the iris.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSEUP
dialogues.text: As he pulls his foot clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he runs through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a beam of LIGHT just misses him.

dialogues.speaker: STEAM
dialogues.text: As steam comes out of the darkness at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he runs by, the steam just missing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he races for the iris at the end of the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl reacts as the iris begins closing.  Quickly, he grabs a crowbar, or other prop, wedges it into the iris, holding it open momentarily.  A moment later, Reef literally hurls himself into the little sub, slams the hatch behind him, and exclaims:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the Shark - right now! Carl does not hesitate, begins working the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Dave - and the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly) 'Fortunes of War!' Carl frowns.  Now Reef grasps the radio microphone, says quickly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) This is Reef, Skipper -- in the Depth-Explorer.  Don't wait for us - start engines, and pull loose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Wendover nods, responding to the radio message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Reef. He turns to the intercom, orders:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reactor Room!  This is the Skipper! I want all reverse full-emergency power!

dialogues.speaker: THE TIGER SHARK PROPELLERS
dialogues.text: They begin to turn, slowly at first, then picking up speed.

dialogues.speaker: SHARK AND DEPTH-EXPLORER
dialogues.text: It moves away from the saucer, back up through the water to the belly of the Shark, at the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see, through a SERIES OF DISSOLVES that the eye is healing - restoring itself, like a balloon being blown up (maybe this would do it).

dialogues.speaker: THE 'FINGERS'
dialogues.text: Purposefully they probe into the 'circuit' apertures, and the power lights begin to glow radiantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Griff superintends preparations to open the lock door, the men from the control room - Wendover, Kent and Sir Ian, hasten in.  Now Griff cracks the hatch on the lock door, and in a moment, Reef staggers out, then helps Carl from the Explorer.  Wendover frowns, glances inside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about --- ? Reef only shakes his head.  Faces are tense, then Reef declares bitterly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't kill it, Skipper.  And if it ever gets...back where it came from...the Earth is doomed, and everything and everybody on it!

dialogues.speaker: TIGER SHARK AND SAUCER
dialogues.text: And now, the mighty engines of the Shark succeed - the bow of the Shark pulls out of the hull of the saucer, and the two vehicles float freely in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene JUMPS AND LURCHES.  Then there is an exultant voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over intercom) We've pulled loose, Skipper! We're free! Wendover and Reef exchange an exultant look.  Then they turn and run out toward the ladder to the con.  Kent, Carl and Sir Ian follow more slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Wendover and Reef come scrambling up the ladder and through the hatch, the man at the helm indicates the TV screen.  Wendover and Reef peer eagerly at it.  Wendover smiles tightly.

dialogues.speaker: OPTICAL SHOT
dialogues.text: And we see the saucer floating loose in the water.  But, suddenly, with a tremendous burst of speed, the saucer moves away through the water, so rapidly as almost to become a blur. REEF (o.s.) (despairingly) There it goes!

dialogues.speaker: UP INTO FACES OF REEF AND WENDOVER
dialogues.text: as Reef adjusts the dials of the screen, and Carl, Kent and Sir Ian appear behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight to the Pole - at almost fifty knots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing we can do, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Captain - there may be one last, desperate chance - a one-in-a-thousand shot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) Anything ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's possible I could adapt one of the torpedo guidance systems to the ICBM - so it would 'home' on the saucer when he rises from the Pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about time...?

dialogues.speaker: REVISED 5-26-59 "ATOMIC SUBMARINE" 110-A
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a glance at Reef) Cyclops will have to linger at the Pole to recharge his power banks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) All right - go to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED) WENDOVER (cont'd) (to Reef) Reef, you take over as navigator. Find us a pot-hole in the ice. And as they AD LIB orders and instructions, Kent and Sir Ian and Carl climb back down the hatch to go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Carl, Kent, Griff and Sir Ian all at work, in- stalling complicated electronic equipment in the nose of the huge ICBM.  Over this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adapt a complicated guidance system to a huge ballistic rocket - convert it to a water-to-air intercept missile?  It was foolish, it was insane, it was fantastic - but it was their only hope - and the earth's only hope!

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUP
dialogues.text: as Kent steps back, wipes his hands on a piece of waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dourly) As ready as we can be! (walking off) I'll report to the Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: THE TIGER SHARK
dialogues.text: It is rising to the surface, under the ice.  And now, as it nears the surface, a BEAM OF LIGHT, like a search- light, hits it, and the water becomes brighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Reef, at the navigator's position, sings out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right under our hole in the ice, Skipper.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN ON ICE
dialogues.text: We see a round, black hole of open water in the ice field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Wendover glues his eye toward the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the corrected bearing to the Magnetic Pole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking) Minus three. Wendover sets a knob on the screen, peers at it again.

dialogues.speaker: OPTICAL SHOT
dialogues.text: All we see is fields of ice and snow.  Finally the cross- hairs stop exactly at minus three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Wendover gestures toward the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take over here, Reef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED) Reef nods, looks at TV screen.  Wendover moves to the intercom, barks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prepare ICBM for firing! Then he murmurs to Reef:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's all we can do -- until our space-friend decides to blast-off.

dialogues.speaker: THE TIGER SHARK
dialogues.text: And now, on the bow, we see the mighty ICBM lift from a recess on the deck, in front of the conning tower.  It stands on end in its cradle, ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reef's eyes on screen.  Wendover waits tensely. Now Reef reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a phenomena like an undersea volcano rising. The ice rends and cracks, rises in a great bulge.

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: It breaks up, boils, tremendous rending, tearing NOISES. Then, from the depths of the water below, a familiar oval shape - smooth, glittering, beautiful - surmounted by the gleaming cyclops eye appears.  The saucer rises from the water like a great porpoise, hovers just above the ice, then begins rising slowly into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Reef exclaims excitedly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper - I think - it is! It's Cyclops! Wendover pushes him aside for a quick look himself. Then, he leaps for the intercom, barks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Skipper!  Fire! Fire!

dialogues.speaker: THE TIGER SHARK
dialogues.text: Now we see a discharge like compressed air below the ICBM.  It floats up and away from the Shark, in a ver- tical position.  Then, straight as an arrow, it heads for the surface.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOLE IN THE ICE
dialogues.text: Now, from the black water, the ICBM leaps into-the air, like a suddenly released, air-filled ball.  As it leaps above the surface, the mighty rocket engines ignite with a ROARING BLAST, and the ICBM leaps high into the air, roars up o.s.

dialogues.speaker: WITH ICBM
dialogues.text: It rises higher and higher, faster and faster, into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAUCER
dialogues.text: It, too, is moving faster and faster, on what should appear to be a converging course with the missile.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKY
dialogues.text: This is the 'money' shot - to make or break the picture. In one corner of the frame, the saucer rises swiftly. But as it moves to center frame, in from the opposite corner comes the ICBM, heading straight and true for the saucer.  They meet. The explosion is tremendous - a mighty, nuclear fireball, great chunks of debris hurled sizzling into space in all directions, a booming, pounding after-shock wave, then a great sweeping mushroom cloud.  After this.....nothing but empty sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shock, the exultation, the relief, then the sagging easement of tension...it is beyond words. Wendover looks at Kent, with a look more eloquent than an hour speech.  Sir Ian's eyes are misty with gratitude.  Carl begins trembling with reaction, and Reef puts a comforting arm around him.  Griff sags onto a stool, head down, just moving his head aimlessly from side to side.  Reef and Wendover exchange a look of silent understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on a moonless night, the stars glinting and sparkling like billions of distant diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: as it swishes through the water on the homeward voyage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 345-A  STOCK SHOT - NAVY YARD - NIGHT (as in 38A)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they slowly walk away from the o.s. submarine towards the gate.  Carl looks thoughtfully up at the sky as he stops for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're so remote - cold - beautiful, the stars.  But now - I wonder -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling fondly) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whimsically) Which is the one - we have to worry about? Reef also looks up at the sky thoughtfully, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe - just 'maybe' - when their ship doesn't return - they'll decide not to come here, after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if they do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soberly) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a slight smile) I wouldn't worry.  So long as we have boats like the Tiger Shark - and people like you, the Skipper, Dave, Kent, Sir Ian and my father -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) And his 'egghead' son! (he punches Carl's arm jovially) We'll give 'em a rough reception, won't we? They go out.
